name: Tiâ€™ Punch Highball
instructions:
1. In a highball glass, add the lime coin and muddle it to express the oils.
2. Add the sugar syrup, rum and 4 ice cubes and stir for a few seconds.
3. Add the coconut water and tonic water, then give one quick stir to integrate the ingredients.
description: Paul McGee stretches the classic Ti' Punch into a highball-like format with the addition of coconut water and tonic.

ingredients.name: Rhum agricole
ingredients.description:
Rhum Agricole is a style of rum that is made from fresh sugarcane juice rather than molasses, which is the byproduct of sugar production. The term "agricole" is French for "agricultural," highlighting the agricultural origin of the sugarcane used in the production.

Rhum Agricole is particularly associated with regions like Martinique and Guadeloupe, where the production of this style of rum has a long and established tradition. The distinctive character of Rhum Agricole has contributed to its popularity among rum enthusiasts and mixologists seeking unique and flavorful spirits.

ingredients.name: Coconut water
ingredients.description: Coconut water (also coconut juice) is the clear liquid inside young coconuts (fruits of the coconut palm).

ingredients.name: Tonic
ingredients.description: Tonic water is a carbonated beverage that is flavored with quinine, a bitter compound derived from the bark of the cinchona tree. Originally used as a prophylactic against malaria due to its quinine content, tonic water has evolved into a popular mixer for various cocktails, especially the classic Gin and Tonic.

ingredients.name: Lime
ingredients.description: Lime is a citrus fruit known for its small size, vibrant green color, and tart flavor.
ingredients.note: half-dollar-sized lime coin with some flesh on it
